key_insight: A modular teleoperation interface plus a scalable learning framework — using ‘choice policies’ to select and sequence submodules — enables robust, coordinated whole‑body humanoid manipulation across head, hands, and legs.
problem_solved: Addresses the challenge of brittle, monolithic controllers by enabling reliable coordination of multiple effectors (head, hands, legs) for manipulation in human‑centric environments.
method: Decompose humanoid control into intuitive submodules: hand‑eye coordination, grasp primitives, arm end‑effector tracking, and locomotion.
Introduce choice policies that select and sequence submodules to produce coordinated whole‑body behaviors.
Use modular teleoperation data to bootstrap and scale learning, improving sample efficiency and robustness during training and deployment.
impact: Makes whole‑body humanoid control more scalable and practical for real-world tasks, lowering operator complexity and accelerating deployment of robots that interact safely and effectively with human environments.

paper_title: Coordinated Humanoid Manipulation with Choice Policies
paper_authors: Haozhi Qi, Yen-Jen Wang, Toru Lin, Brent Yi, Yi Ma
